trans-unit.source: Use Azure storage in Windows Store apps | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Use Azure storage in Windows Store apps | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Azure blobs, queues, and tables to store data for a Windows Store app.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Azure blobs, queues, and tables to store data for a Windows Store app.

trans-unit.source: How to use Azure Storage in Windows Store apps
trans-unit.target: How to use Azure Storage in Windows Store apps

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This guide shows how to get started with developing a Windows Store app that makes use of Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: This guide shows how to get started with developing a Windows Store app that makes use of Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: Download required tools
trans-unit.target: Download required tools

trans-unit.source: [Visual Studio 2012](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br211384) makes it easy to build, debug, localize, package, and deploy Windows Store apps.
trans-unit.target: [Visual Studio 2012](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br211384) makes it easy to build, debug, localize, package, and deploy Windows Store apps.

trans-unit.source: [Azure Storage Client Library for Windows Runtime](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsazurestorage/archive/2012/11/05/windows-azure-storage-client-library-for-windows-runtime.aspx) provides a class library for working with Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: [Azure Storage Client Library for Windows Runtime](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsazurestorage/archive/2012/11/05/windows-azure-storage-client-library-for-windows-runtime.aspx) provides a class library for working with Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: [WCF Data Services Tools for Windows Store Apps](http://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=30714) extends the Add Service Reference experience with client-side OData support for Windows Store apps in Visual Studio 2012 and later.
trans-unit.target: [WCF Data Services Tools for Windows Store Apps](http://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=30714) extends the Add Service Reference experience with client-side OData support for Windows Store apps in Visual Studio 2012 and later.

trans-unit.source: Develop apps
trans-unit.target: Develop apps

trans-unit.source: Getting ready
trans-unit.target: Getting ready

trans-unit.source: Create a new Windows Store app project in Visual Studio 2012 or later:
trans-unit.target: Create a new Windows Store app project in Visual Studio 2012 or later:

trans-unit.source: store-apps-storage-vs-project
trans-unit.target: store-apps-storage-vs-project

trans-unit.source: Next, add a reference to the Azure Storage Client Library by right-clicking **References**, clicking **Add Reference**, and then browsing to the Storage Client Library for Windows Runtime that you downloaded:
trans-unit.target: Next, add a reference to the Azure Storage Client Library by right-clicking **References**, clicking **Add Reference**, and then browsing to the Storage Client Library for Windows Runtime that you downloaded:

trans-unit.source: store-apps-storage-choose-library
trans-unit.target: store-apps-storage-choose-library

trans-unit.source: Using the library with the Blob and Queue services
trans-unit.target: Using the library with the Blob and Queue services

trans-unit.source: At this point, your app is ready to call the Azure Blob and Queue services.
trans-unit.target: At this point, your app is ready to call the Azure Blob and Queue services.

trans-unit.source: Add the following **using** statements so that Azure Storage types can be referenced directly:
trans-unit.target: Add the following **using** statements so that Azure Storage types can be referenced directly:

trans-unit.source: Next, add a button to your page.
trans-unit.target: Next, add a button to your page.

trans-unit.source: Add the following code to its **Click** event and modify your event handler method by using the [async keyword](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/vstudio/hh156513.aspx):
trans-unit.target: Add the following code to its **Click** event and modify your event handler method by using the [async keyword](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/vstudio/hh156513.aspx):

trans-unit.source: This code assumes that you have two string variables, *accountName* and *accountKey*.
trans-unit.target: This code assumes that you have two string variables, *accountName* and *accountKey*.

trans-unit.source: They represent the name of your storage account and the account key that is associated with that account.
trans-unit.target: They represent the name of your storage account and the account key that is associated with that account.

trans-unit.source: Build and run the application.
trans-unit.target: Build and run the application.

trans-unit.source: Clicking the button will check whether a container named *container1* exists in your account and then create it if not.
trans-unit.target: Clicking the button will check whether a container named *container1* exists in your account and then create it if not.

trans-unit.source: Using the library with the Table service
trans-unit.target: Using the library with the Table service

trans-unit.source: Types that are used to communicate with the Azure Table service depend on WCF Data Services for the Windows Store app library.
trans-unit.target: Types that are used to communicate with the Azure Table service depend on WCF Data Services for the Windows Store app library.

trans-unit.source: Next, add a reference to the required WCF libraries by using the Package Manager Console:
trans-unit.target: Next, add a reference to the required WCF libraries by using the Package Manager Console:

trans-unit.source: store-apps-storage-package-manager
trans-unit.target: store-apps-storage-package-manager

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to point Package Manager to the location on your machine:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to point Package Manager to the location on your machine:

trans-unit.source: This command will automatically add all required references to your project.
trans-unit.target: This command will automatically add all required references to your project.

trans-unit.source: If you do not want to use the Package Manager Console, you can add the WCF Data Services NuGet folder on your local machine to the list of package sources and then add the reference through the UI, as described in [Managing NuGet Packages Using the Dialog](http://docs.nuget.org/docs/start-here/Managing-NuGet-Packages-Using-The-Dialog).
trans-unit.target: If you do not want to use the Package Manager Console, you can add the WCF Data Services NuGet folder on your local machine to the list of package sources and then add the reference through the UI, as described in [Managing NuGet Packages Using the Dialog](http://docs.nuget.org/docs/start-here/Managing-NuGet-Packages-Using-The-Dialog).

trans-unit.source: When you have referenced the WCF Data Services NuGet package, change the code in your button's **Click** event:
trans-unit.target: When you have referenced the WCF Data Services NuGet package, change the code in your button's **Click** event:

trans-unit.source: This code checks whether a table named *table1* exists in your account, and then creates it if not.
trans-unit.target: This code checks whether a table named *table1* exists in your account, and then creates it if not.

trans-unit.source: You can also add a reference to Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.Table.dll, which is available in the same package that you downloaded.
trans-unit.target: You can also add a reference to Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.Table.dll, which is available in the same package that you downloaded.

trans-unit.source: This library contains additional functionality, such as reflection-based serialization and generic queries.
trans-unit.target: This library contains additional functionality, such as reflection-based serialization and generic queries.

trans-unit.source: Note that this library does not support JavaScript.
trans-unit.target: Note that this library does not support JavaScript.
